Newsletter: Season Two

Welcome to the second series of the Jear-Bear letters. For the new readers, this is my weekly newsletter. I used to write short essays of things that interested me with an intention I could read this a year later and remain interested.

During months of February and March, I will be writing letters on the theme of "repeated failure". Expect releases on Monday, unless I get too busy and release a Tuesday letter.

If you like what you're reading, share this newsletter. You could go as far as sharing it on Facebook, Twitter, or going retro, snail mail! If you're feeling adventurous, subscribe them by entering their email on my Tinyletter page.

  • The Problem of Rushing Through
    Published April 17, 2017
    Where I talk about my failure to slow down.
  • The Placement Problem
    Published April 04, 2017
    Where I talk about my failure to find my belongings.
  • The Loneliness Problem
    Published March 30, 2017
    Where I talk about my failure to be alone.
  • The Problem With the Rider and the Elephant
    Published March 15, 2017
    Where I talk about my failure to compromise between emotion and rationality.
  • The Reactive Problem
    Published March 06, 2017
    Where I talk about my failure to stop reacting.
  • The Reliance Problem
    Published February 25, 2017
    Where I talk about my failure to remember.
  • The Bystander Problem
    Published February 20, 2017
    Where I talk about my failure to speak up.
  • The Negligence Problem
    Published February 07, 2017
    Where I talk about my failure to act.
